text: hi my name's kelly griffin and i'm a
solution architect with aws
today i'm going to provide you with a
quick overview of the amazon s3 file
gateway
so let's jump right in the aws storage
gateway acts as a bridge
to provide access to virtually unlimited
cloud storage
by connecting applications running
on-premises to amazon storage
the storage gateway allows customers to
connect to and use
key cloud storage services such as
amazon s3
amazon s3 glacier amazon fsx for windows
file server
and amazon elastic block store the
storage gateway
easily deploys on-premises using a
pre-configured hardware appliance
or as a virtual machine that supports
all of the major hypervisors
by providing a local cache storage
gateway enables low latency access to
frequently accessed data
the storage gateway supports access via
storage protocols
such as nfs smb and iscsi vtl
so no changes to customer applications
are required
and data is transferred securely and
efficiently between the on-premises
environment
and aws there are four different
types of gateways customers use the s3
file gateway to store file data into s3
for use by
object-based workloads including data
analytics or machine learning
as a cost-effective target for backups
and as a repository
or tier in the cloud for application
file storage
the fsx file gateway provides low
latency access to amazon fsx for windows
file server data
on premise making it easy for users to
access fsx for windows file server data
while conserving shared bandwidth you
can use the tape gateway to replace
existing physical tape libraries with a
virtual tape library or vtl
you can continue to use your existing
backup applications and workflows
while writing to a nearly limitless
collection of virtual tapes
and each virtual tape is stored in
amazon s3
where it can be stored for long term
requirements
the volume gateway presents your
application block storage volumes
using the iscsi protocol and data
written to these volumes can be
asynchronously backed up
as point-in-time snapshots of your
volumes and these can be stored in the
cloud as amazon ebs snapshots
a file gateway simplifies file storage
in amazon s3 and integrates to existing
applications through industry standard
file system protocols
as well as providing a cost-effective
alternative
to an on-premises storage it also
provides low latency access to data
through transparent local caching
the file gateway presents a file
interface that enables you to store
files as
objects in amazon s3 using nfs
and smb file protocols the gateway
provides access to objects in
s3 as files or as a file
share mount point which can be
controlled via posix
or active directory permissions with a
file gateway
you can access your data directly in
amazon s3
used from any aws cloud application or
service
and you can manage your amazon s3 data
using lifecycle policies
cross region replication and versioning
you can think of a file gateway
as a file system mount on s3
so let's have a look at a demonstration
on using the file gateway
for backing up a sql server and storing
the sql backup files within s3 so here
we are
in the console we have our storage
gateway
now if we edit this information we can
have a look at our smb settings here
we can see that we're joined to an
active directory
and this is our file storage gateway
using s3 we can have a look at some
metrics as well if we need to
and these are pulling directly from
cloudwatch
if we have a look at our file shares
you can see that we have a file share
already connected here
and you can see down the bottom there
how we can connect this
to a windows server let's jump over to a
sql server
where we have a backup job that is
writing directly to our s3
file gateway i'm connected on premise
so you can see there we're connecting
our backup
we're writing it back up to the file
gateway
and you can see there the file gateway
mapped to our z drive we have a number
of backup files in there
and they're writing directly to our s3
file gateway so now let's run a backup
this shouldn't take very long
and that's now successful so now if we
have a look
in our file system again
and refresh you can see that our backup
has now been written to the s3 file
gateway
and we can also see that information
inside event viewer
so i hope this has been an informative
overview of a use case
utilizing the aws storage gateway you
can find
additional information and documentation
by accessing the aws storage gateway
product page
thank you
